Specific Details: Two requests that the JOC on EU Affairs, and the JOC on Enterprise, Trade and Employment undertake a review of Ireland’s position regarding the proposal at the WTO to issue waiver from certain provisions of the TRIPS Agreement for the prevention, containment and treatment of Covid-19.

Subject Matter: Two requests that the JOC on EU Affairs, and the JOC on Enterprise, Trade and Employment undertake a review of Ireland’s position regarding the proposal at the WTO to issue waiver from certain provisions of the TRIPS Agreement for the prevention, containment and treatment of Covid-19.
Intended Results: Review of Ireland’s position regarding the proposal at the WTO to issue a waiver from certain provisions of the TRIPS Agreement for the prevention, containment and treatment of Covid-19.
Lobbying Activities:
1/4/2021, Two letters - one to Deputy Joe Mc Hugh and another to Deputy Maurice Quinlivan - signed by 14 NGOs of which Misean Cara was a signatory calling for a review of Ireland’s position regarding the proposal at the WTO to issue a waiver from certain provisions of the TRIPS Agreement for the prevention, containment and treatment of Covid-19.  

Cc John Brady TD, Francis Noel Duffy TD, Dara Calleary TD, Marian Harkin TD, Sean Haughey TD, Brendan Howlin TD, Neale Richmond TD, Ruairí O’Murchú TD, Senator Lisa Chambers, Senator Regina Doherty, Senator Sharon Keogan, Senator Vincent P. Martin, Senator Michael McDowell, Fiona Cashin, Clerk to the Committee|Letter|2-5
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: John Moffett, CEO Misean Cara - part of a civil society letter from many NGOs coordinated by Oxfam Ireland
